TF021251-PHRD-JAPANESE CTF (USD ACCOUNT),TF034016-CHINA - SHANGHAI-ZHEJIANG
            HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF033417-CHINA - XINJIANG HIGHWAYS I

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the environmental
            impact assessment study are to: 1) study the present
            environmental conditions along the proposed expressway and
            the environmental impact of vehicle volume of existing
            roads; 2) identify the distribution features of human
            landscapes and historic antiquities, as well as probable
            influences on these by the new expressway to be built; 3)
            forecast the environmental impacts in the construction phase
            of the expressway; 4) forecast the range of the pollutants
            and the concentrations in case of maximum traffic during the
            operation of the expressway; and 5) forecast adverse
            environmental impact of accident emission of pollutant
            sources.  The enviromental issues in the implementation
            phase of the expressway project are divided into three
            categories: air quality changing, noise impact and water
            quality impact.  These categories of environmental issues
            are futher divided into: 1) resettlement; 2) soil erosion;
            3) visual impact; 4) social activities and historic relics;
            5) flooding drainage; 6) environment and construction
            related impacts; and 7) environment and operation related
            impact.  This study covers each of these impacts for the
            operating phase and also analyzes the impacts during the
            construction and the operation phases.
